ul.li: LEFT HDPT - Power on the left fuselage hardpoint (normally targeting or navigation pods)
OFF - Power off the left fuselage hardpoint
RIGHT HDPT - Power on the right fuselage hardpoint (normally targeting or navigation pods)
OFF - Power off the right fuselage hardpoint
FCR - Powers up the FCR
OFF - Powers down the FCR
RDR ALT - Power on the radar altimeter
STBY - Set the radar altimeter to standby
OFF - Power off the radar altimeter
Controls display of various HUD scales
VV/VAH - Displays vertical velocity, velocity, altitude, and heading scales; roll indicator above the FPM
VAH - Displays velocity, altitude, and heading scales; roll indicator below the heading tape
OFF - All scales off except for digital readout windows for velocity, altitude and heading; roll indicator below the heading
Controls flightpath marker (FPM) symbology
ATT/FPM - Displays the FPM and the attitude reference bars
FPM - Displays the FPM and removes the attitude reference bars
OFF - Removes the attitude reference bars and the FPM
Controls the display of either the DED or PFL data in the HUD window
DED - DED data
PFL - PFL data
OFF - Neither
Controls selection of the primary and standby manual bomb aiming reticles
STBY - Selects the standby reticle and removes all other symbology (this option is available even if the HUD fails)
PRI - Selects the primary reticle and does not remove all other symbology
OFF - No reticle selected
The reticle is moved downward on the HUD with the Reticle Depression Control Knob on the ICP
Controls the selection of the three aircraft velocity scales in the HUD
CAS - Calibrated airspeed
TAS - True airspeed
GND SPD - Ground speed
Note that if the gear is lowered while Ground speed is selected, the HUD airspeed reverts back to CAS
Controls the selection of the three aircraft altitude scales displayed on the HUD
ALT RADAR - Radar altitude (AGL)
BARO - Barometric altitude (MSL)
AUTO (mislabeled OFF) - Displays radar altitude while below 1500 ft AGL and barometric altitude when higher than 1500 ft AGL
Controls HUD brightness
DAY - Ranges from off to full intensity
AUTO BRT - Automatically maintains a specified symbol-to-background contrast level
NIGHT - Ranges from off to half intensity
Displays four HUD test patterns
STEP - Cycles between patterns
ON - Displays the first test pattern
OFF - No test pattern
Varies the backlight brightness of the right and left auxiliary and primary consoles

area.title: Primary Instrument Panel Brightness Adjustment Knob

ul.li: Varies the backlight brightness of the instrument panel

area.title: Data Entry Display Brightness Adjustment Knob

ul.li: Varies the brightness of the DED and PFLD

area.title: Consoles Floodlights Brightness Intensity Knob
area.impl: Controls the intensity of the floodlights throughout the cockpit

ul.li: Varies the intensity of the floodlights shining on the right and left auxiliary and primary consoles

area.title: Instrument Panel Floodlights Brightness Intensity Knob

ul.li: Varies the intensity of the floodlights shining on the main instrument panel

area.title: Malfunction and Indicator Lights Intensity Switch

ul.li: Controls the light intensity of all the warning, caution, and indicator lights except the following individually-dimmed lights: AOA indexer, AR/NWS indexer, DED, ECM control panel, MFDs, PFLD, TWS indicators
Controls the temperature of the cockpit
OFF-COOL-AUTO-WARM - Set air condition automatically between off, cold and warm
OFF-COOL-MAN-WARM - Set air condition manually between off, cold and warm
Controls the source of air used for pressurizing/ ventilating the cockpit, G-suit, and fuel tanks
OFF - Engine bleed air valves close and all pressurizing functions shut off
NORM - Air conditioning set for normal temperature and pressure regulation
DUMP - Cockpit pressure dump valve opens to atmospheric pressure
RAM - Engine bleed air valves close. Cockpit pressure dump valve opens. All pressurizing and temperature control functions shut off. The ram air valve opens to ventilate the cockpit and avionics.
Guarded, three position toggle switch
ARM REL - Allows Nuclear ordinance to be armed and dropped, providing consent has been received
OFF (Safe) - Does not allow Nuclear ordinance to be dropped
REL ONLY - Allows Nuclear ordinance to be dropped but not armed, this being used to jettison the Nuclear ordinance in emergencies
Works in conjunction with the KY-58 Secure Voice System
CRAD 1 - UHF radio encrypted via KY-58
PLAIN - No radios encrypted
CRAD 2 - VHF radio encrypted via KY-58
Guarded, three position toggle switch
Purges data associated with the Data Transfer Cartridge, FCC, GPS, AIFF Mode-4, Programmable Display Generator, and RWR
Seat ejection automatically performs an escape zeroize operation
INHIBIT - Allows the suppression of VMU aural messages
